intro: Taeniophyllum annuliferum, commonly known as the spiral moss, is a unique species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of its leafy shoots, which gives it its common name. The plant forms dense, cushion-like mats on moist, shaded substrates such as rocks and soil. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinct midrib, contributing to its ornamental appearance. Taeniophyllum annuliferum is primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid environments.
